conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C.
The liquid flows downward from A and encounters a baffle. The baffle directs the flow to the right.
The liquid flows downward from B and encounters a baffle. The baffle directs the flow to the left.
The liquid flows downward from C and encounters a baffle. The baffle directs the flow to the right.

premise: The liquid flows downward from A and encounters a baffle. The baffle directs the flow to the right.
conclusion: After being directed to the right, the liquid from A continues downward and flows into container E.

premise: The liquid flows downward from B and encounters a baffle. The baffle directs the flow to the left.
conclusion: After being directed to the left, the liquid from B continues downward and flows into container D.

premise: The liquid flows downward from C and encounters a baffle. The baffle directs the flow to the right.
conclusion: After being directed to the right, the liquid from C continues downward and flows into container E.

premise: After being directed to the right, the liquid from A continues downward and flows into container E. After being directed to the right, the liquid from C continues downward and flows into container E. After being directed to the left, the liquid from B continues downward and flows into container D.
conclusion: The liquid from A and C will flow into container E. The liquid from B will flow into container D.
